meanings.definition: A unit of currency in some countries.
meanings.sent1: In that country, you can buy a lot with just a few quintars.
meanings.sent2: She exchanged her dollars for quintars at the bank.
meanings.sent3: The quintars in his wallet seemed to multiply overnight!
meanings.sent4: His hard work paid off, and now he was swimming in quintars.
meanings.sent5: The shiny quintars jingled in her pocket as she walked.

meanings.definition: A plural form of the word 'quintar'.
meanings.sent1: The market was bustling with vendors selling quintars.
meanings.sent2: They counted the quintars carefully before making the purchase.
meanings.sent3: The quintars on the table looked like a tiny mountain of coins.
meanings.sent4: The room was filled with the sound of clinking quintars.
meanings.sent5: She saved up all her quintars to buy a special gift.
